figure_1.title: Figure 1.
figure_1.caption:
Moderate relative intensity cadence discrepancy scores between conditions.
Note. N =23. The horizontal solid line represents perfect synchronization to moderate relative intensity cadence.
The horizontal dashed line represents ±3 steps min−1 of moderate relative intensity cadence.

claims.sentence: As shown in Figure 1c, during the music condition 2 of 23 participants (8.70%) achieved perfect synchronization with the prescribed moderate relative intensity walking cadence, whereas 6 of 23 (26.10%) walked within ±3 steps min−1.
Significant effects are given in bold.Figure 1.

However, the ability to entrain varied, with only 8.70% of participants achieving perfect synchronization, and 26.10% within 3 steps −1 (Figure 1c), which was triangulated by qualitative findings, and likely responsible for the inconsistent attainment of moderative relative intensity within this condition.
As shown in Figure 1, participants with a prescribed cadence outside this range exhibited greatest deviations, supporting the existence of an ‘entrainment basin’ (64).

As shown in Figure 1b, only 13% of participants walked within 3 steps min−1 of their prescribed cadence, corroborated by qualitative findings, with 19% of participants specifying this as the easiest aid to implement.
